the San

[ plural ] one of the first groups of people to live in southern Africa, especially in the Kalahari desert, who used to live as hunter-gatherers but are now mainly farmers: The San were also referred to as Bushmen, but this term has since been abandoned as it is considered derogatory. Researchers discovered the DNA of the San people was more diverse than any other group. Compare
Bushman sometimes offensive
More examplesFewer examplesFor thousands of generations the San lived, hunting and gathering, as the sole occupants of southern Africa. Last September, my wife and I had the privilege to visit a San village in Botswana.The South African San Council has launched a code of ethics to guide researchers to stop intrusive and sometimes exploitative research in San communities.
